Name: The End: A Postapocalyptic Novel (The New World Series)

ReviewList.Text: I can't find any other books on Amazon by Hopf, so I am going to make the assumption this was a first published book.  If so BRAVO!!!!!  I loved the style, loved the complexity of the plot, the great characters, and the realistic breakdown of society in my hometown (scary though that might be).  I can hardly wait for the next installment, which I sincerely hope is currently in process....I have to find out what happens to Gordon, Samantha, Hunter, Sebatian, and crew.  If you want a good read and enjoy end of the world fiction read this, it truly is good!

I was looking forward to this as I enjoy the genre, but could not get past the first 15 pages. The writing style is simply not up to par with professional writers. The stilted dialogue, poor sentence structure, limited vocabulary, and grammar errors were too much to bear. I want to support self-publishing writers, but these writers should respect those purchasing their books and work to refine their writing and editing skills before publishing.

More than any other genre, I love the post-apocalyptic world for the simple reason that it always makes me ask, "What would you do?" That is the case with The End; I liked the variety of characters, each of whom answers that question differently. And after reading up on the author, was amamzed at the similarities between the author and the main character. I now certainly know what G. Michael Hopf would do! And one nice touch: some of the most evil people in this book are the most ordinary.(SPOILER) Usually you see the neo nazis or gang-bangers as the bad guys (The End has this too) but the most vile character in the book is the President of the Home Owners Association! That is certainly way too real! One complaint - the Editor missed numerous typos and grammatical errors but don't let that get in the way of a really good read.

I am honestly shocked at the large number of reviews that rate this book so well.  I was disenchanted with the book by the time I reached about 25% of the way through, but kept reading - thinking something was going to happen that would discuss in some significance the breakdown of society because of the apocalyptic event. Instead, the greatest amount of true discussion about the restructuring of society seems to be with the main characters disputes with his neighborhood HOA president.  Then, the main character (whose background and personality traits are barely explored) makes extremely unlikable, violent decisions that even when considering the state of the new society still make no sense.  Meanwhile, the main character's wife seems to carry on in her daily life as if the destruction of society is no big deal with a perfectly melancholy attitude.  Lastly, the portrayal of the US Marines is unsettling to say the last.  The mutiny of the Marines, and eventual murdering of Marines by Marines is not only unbelievable but rather offensive, and basically helped me stop wasting my time as I deleted the book from my Kindle at the 61% mark.
Well written. I appreciate the way the characters  we're developed. I can't wait for the next book in the series.

Very few authors have the ability to grab my attention with just the very first pages of a book. This author had that ability! This was a great book....one I couldn't put down right from the beginning. The storyline as well as the characters were well developed. I look forward to reading more from this author.

the book immediately draws the reader into the story.  extremely good character development, well paced action, really like how he has different stories happening simultaneously (on a ship and on land).  the book is very compelling, making it difficult to put it down. the author's research into what can happen when this type of disaster strikes makes the novel very realistic.....and scary. i was glad he didn't dwell on gory scenes - many authors spend too much time trying to gross out the reader. i'm an avid reader and was extremely impressed with this author, particularly since this is his first novel. he writes as well as many of the top-notch experienced writers. i am anxious for the sequel to see how the lives of the characters develop. it was a very satisfying read and i would recommend it highly.

This book was one of the best I've read.  Everything from writing style,  characters,  and plot kept me glued to this book. And im glad the author actually made the dialog of the characters believable.  I've read too many books that looses my interest when the grammer they use is very unbelievable.  Thank you to Mr. Hopf for an amazing book and I can't wait for the next one.
Really a good book! So hard to put down. Well written like only a veteran could do.on to the next

Absolutely horrifying. The author does a great job of making you feel like you are in the novel... like it could be real. I can't stop thinking and dreaming about this dang book. Makes me glad I married a marine. Can't wait for the rest of the series.
Hard to put down when you start.  Well developed characters and a good story line. A very enjoyable read and am looking forward to the next book that is coming out this summer.  Good job.
Turn the TV off and enjoy this great weekend read. The good guys are really good and the bad guys end up dead; hard to beat that.

I bought this book because I pretty much read all the other books in the genre. I really enjoyed this book, the story is plausable and the actions and reactions of the characters are more realistic than some other books I've read. In a nutshell I highly reccomend it.

Read it and liked it. The End had a different story line and actually portrayed a community after a catastrophic event. The End also put the reader in the shoes of the average military enlistee stationed far from home when a crisis state-side occurs. Most 'doomsday' or 'end times' books have the same scenario with some prep 'how tos' thrown in. Placing aside the graphic home defense scenes, which are realistic having seen the aftermath of a home invasion; I think even the most 'girlie-girl' can envision how a SHTF situation will unfold. ~ Sorry Virginia, there is NO Santa Clause after a crisis!

I loved this novel: The End - A Post Apocalyptic Novel by G. Michael Hopf and gave it 5 stars. A remarkable piece of writing. Very engaging and mature literary work. Reads like an accomplished author wrote it. Strong character development and multiple storylines that mesh well. I strongly recommend this novel for anyone who likes Clancy or other military thrillers. The book flows like that. This is money well spent. Couldn't put it down.
This is one of my favorite series now. The characters are great and story is even better. Just  got done with part 3 hope he's writing part 4 now.
Couldn't put it down can't wait till " the long road" graces my iPad I have already purchased it. Great author

I read this one and am listening to the second The Long Road via Auidable.com I prefer it the 2nd is better but you have to read to this one to understand what the 2nd is about. But I am ok with spending the money on both and it should  be interesting when the 3rd comes out I'll buy it hopefully it'll be on Auidable as well.
The writer makes this a hard to put down book and makes you want to see what happens next. Can't wait for the next book of the series.

I read a fair amount of post apocalyptic/ sci fi/ survival/ zombie (no zombies in this let me make that clear) "literature" and had a blast reading this; I was pleasantly surprised by how quickly I found myself sucked in. Found it very easy to imagine things going south very quickly in the event such an attack took place- didn't help that I live in the city written about I suppose. Frequently found myself asking what would I do in such a situation? I recommend this to anyone who likes a good post apocalyptic read- up there with "The Remaining" series if you have read that! And if you haven't you should!
I've read a bunch of post apocalypse stories and this is definitely one of the better ones. Can't wait for the third one.
Fast pace. Lots of action. Fun to read. Some parts a little corny but it's a super fun fast read.

This book has been an amazing read full of twists and turns and a dynamic representation of a SHTF scenario. I've read many such books and by and far this is my favorite. I'd highly recommend this read to anyone looking for  theoretical psychology concerning a SHTF event and will offer real insight into how things will unfold in a post collapse America.

So many things to consider as this could be a real possibility in our future.  The novel is fast paced, well written with many separate stories within. Before I was even halfway through the book, I downloaded the 2nd book in this series to my Kindle and pre-ordered the 3rd book in the series to be available this month.  A great read and all should read and be prepared.

I really loved this book. I am a recent new fan of the post-apocalyptic genre, and now I see why so many people like these stories. The story is paced really well, with lots of suspense and yet it has a balance of character development. I read the author’s bio and now I see why the technical details and military aspects are so believable; he’s a Marine Corp veteran. The story really made me think about “what if” this happened to my family. What would we do? I’m a fan of the TV series Evolution, which has elements of an EMP attack, and this story-line is as good or better. This book has really strong cinematic potential, and I hope they make it into a movie. I will definitely buy the next in the series, Sanctuary. Well done G. Michael Hoph! You have a new fan. Keep up the good work!

I got to meet the author and a convention and he handed me a free copy of this book.  I was skeptical because who hands out their book for free?  Have to say I was wrong in my perception.  It was a fun read.  I enjoyed the characters and could totally relate to them.  Pick up the book and just enjoy.

I'm always looking for a good post apocalyptic story and this author provides a different view of what the world would be like as the result of an EMP.  No zombies in this version, but it really got me thinking about the whole EMP business.  the character development was strong and I immediately read the 2nd book in the series to find out what happens next.
I enjoyed reading this first installment of the series. The story evolved differently than others in the genre, perhaps not exactly as I would have written it, but, the plot twists were interesting.
Again, proper grammar and spelling was so appreciated by this reader. Intense story line that keeps the reader's interest. enjoyed
Great perspective on the end of the world as we know it. A true representation of just how fast civilization would collapse and how quickly morality would deteriorate.
Had this book read in two days because I couldn't put it down. This was a brutal & raw look at what could happen after an apocalypse.
A great end of the world read from a preppers perspective! Loved all of the military references and slang, very well done!
I could not put this book down. I hope same day they make it a movie. This book also makes you think about what could be inevitable!
Loved it, this could happen to us, we need to be prepared! Excellent reading, good time line and character formation!
A great read. I had a hard time putting it down. Very thought provoking. I look forward to the next book…
I enjoyed this book and most others that I have read that are of similar content. In todays world, it's not hard to imagine it as happening right now!
This story was very exciting and fast to read I ordered the next book immediately. I recommend this story to anyone
This is a great series! Grabs your attention right from the beginning. Looking forward to the next book- due out in 2014
It is an excellent book. This will be an easy book to recommend tofriends and family. A great story in human nature.

I am way into the post apocalyptic series (prefer that on audio than written) but once I saw this book and the mixed reviews I got curious, I had to form my own opinion. I am glad I gave it a shot, this is my new favorite post apocalyptic series!!! I enjoy how the author pushes the boundaries of human nature when there is no rule of law and no government. Contrary from what others have said, the personages have depth, you just have to give it time for the different scenes to shape their character. Its only 5 bucks, give it a shot and see it for yourself, then come back here and let others know, I think this is a great read, and I am through with book 2 already, its just as good! I recommend it to anyone.
There were some punctuation and grammar mistakes that were a little annoying but it still was a great book to read

Very intelligently done, gave a realistic idea of what could possibly happen in a scenario like this. It could very well happen to us, hopefully it won't, but you better be ready for it. Enjoyed it immensely, highly recommend it to all, but it is very dark.

I really loved reading this book, inspired me to get my emergency kit sorted ASAP! Loved our anti hero and his shoot first ask questions later attitude. Not sure why all the terrible reviews but I am neither a critic nor an American, Just joe blog book enthusiast!

Loved this book. Was away on holiday, ended up buying this one, the next one, plus a whole bunch of other similar style books. I really enjoyed it, couldn't put it down. Characters well written, story line is well thought out. I am eagerly awaiting the third instalment. If you are into the walking dead series, Jericho tv series,  fall out games, anything survivor oriented, you'll love this!
I love the books on Kindle!  We want more...  I am rereading a lot waiting on the new installment of the saga.
The idea of losing electricity and all the conveniences I have now would be devastating, and the story kept me on the edge.
I've read both books in this series to date and cannot wait for more!  Had me hooked immediately.  I love post apocalyptic fiction and this is some the best EVER!!!

Exciting, riveting story line.  My husband I both loved it and could not stop listening to the audio until it ended---and even then we said NOOOOooooooo it isn't over.  Can't wait to get the second in this series.  It is not a light hearted book.  But it will keep your interest to the very end.  So, many things I like my husband is bored with.  No one will be bored with this one.

I read this book a few months ago and it stuck in my mind enough to want to post a review. As a hard core fan of apocalyptic fiction, I rank this one up there with some of the classics. Having lived in San Diego for more than a decade, I was able to picture the area and appreciate the destructive effects of losing all power and modern technology. As society crumbles, ordinary people strive to secure the means of survival. Most will not succeed. This book will be a favorite among preppers and doomsday fans. I also enjoyed the sequel and look forward to more from this new author.

Great read.  I didn't want it to end.  I couldn't buy the next book in the series quickly enough and start reading it.  The story was gripping and the characters endearing, yet they do what they need to do to survive.
I Couldn't put this book down once I started reading it. This book kept my interest until the last page!

I was not sure I would get into this book as I had read an apocalyptic novel of similar subject a few months ago but this book grabbed me and shook my complacent mind into a frenzy of fear that this could very well happen to our country. A great read for military vets especially marines as well as civilians because it shows interactions and accomplishments of both in a world gone crazy.

Well written book that keeps the reader enthralled with all the different ongoing activities of each of the characters. The book ,although fiction  is not totally unfeasible from a possible reality  if a similar crisis were to happen in the US.

Is say local because all of this occurred in my home town. All the streets and stores mentioned are places I know very well,although I could have sworn it was a home depot off Mira mesa and not a Lowe's.  Anyways, this was a fast paced thriller about a worst case scenario of an emp stopping America answering situation from several different vantage point. I really like it an  I plan to be  the next book.
I liked that there were no zombies or monsters. The author gives you something to think about. it was very realistic and kept me turning the pages.
This is a very good book. The genre is one of my favorites. I definitely will read the next book in the series.
Amazing story. Makes you wonder how your friends would fare in this type of situation. I only hope I would be able to keep my family safe.
It's not rocket science, but I certainly enjoyed it, so much that I purchased the second book after getting the first via the lending library, cheers, and please keep up the good entertainment
A novel but very realistic and I am glad to have read it . The title  is a little misleading in that many think it is about the biblical end time.

Overall the tone of this book is pretty harsh, but its a good story with good characters.  The actual premise of a high altitute emp completing wiping out everything electronic isn't actually true but like any other work of fiction some suspended belief is required.  The character development was good and it helps to set up and explain the sometimes brutal violence contained in the story.  this is a good post-apocalypse story with some raw human elements.
Outstanding story.  Finished the read in 7 days.  Just started Book 2. I hope the author can keep up, please drink more coffee..

I am getting the 2nd book right away.  Thus was hard to put down.  I missed my bus stop once because i was so into the book.  I have read several post apocalyptic books and this is my favorite.  Makes you think about the possibility and hope this never happens.  It tells 3 stories that are happening at the same time.  It keeps you interesting in all 3 and turning the page hoping to get back to your favorite one soon or not to leave the one you are currently on.  I cant wait to start the second one.
I enjoyed the story, however realistic it seems.  Good writing and plot creation, quite impressed. I will be reading his next book.

This is the first book I have read of this author. This book grabs you from the beginning and doesn't let you go. The way the author explains everything, it makes you feel like your living this nightmare with them.
I thought that the author did a great job in realistically portraying how quickly society could devolve into the Dark Ages.
I found this a well put together story.  It moves along at a good pace.  Believable characters, and plot.  Good read.
I enjoyed the book. It was too short but worth the price. Off to read the second book. Buy it

I got this book for free.This book started and never stopped grabbing my attention. This is the first apocalyptic type book for me.It was eyeopening and terified me to the extent that I now know that I/we should be preparing for this to be happening yesterday! This is our reality,If you look at what is happening with our government today.Most people think we can depend on our government to take care of us in any catastrophy.This book showed me to not be so blind.The way the story played out was all to real and I now know that I am not at all prepared for what is inevitable.Even starting now there is not enough time to prepare. This I feel is one of the most important books  I have ever read and wish I had read such a book 40 yrs. ago so I would be prepared for the inevitable today.This book is fiction, today!
Well written of what could possibly be a reality one day. Scary! Great story, can't wait to start on sequel
A page turner, hard to put down once you start. One of the better novels I've read in this genre.
On par with Tom Clancy for detail and development.  These stories will really make you think on how prepared you might be for this sort of world.
I don't like to have to review other peoples work. What is good for one person might not be good for another. But thank you

I've been reading post apocalypse fiction for a few months now and most are fanciful and with limited scientific accuracy.  This series is spot on.  Michael got it right and his story is the super scary truth of how fragile our way of life has become.  I can't wait for the third book.
It's unfortunate that i can only give this book five stars because it deserves many more! Exciting, well thought, well written! Fresh and inventive. Awesome!

I am s huge fan of Alas Babylon and imagine it as a manual for when the world ends. However, this book is a modern version of that with the violent reality of how our world will be after it end. Where Babylon touched the surface of post war reality, The End takes you over and beyond.

I believe this is Mr. Hopf's first novel, and he deserves congratulations for an exceptional writing debut.  If you have any interest in post-apocalyptic stories, you'll really enjoy it.  If you don't have an interest, you'll probably enjoy it anyway.  The book is well written and the characters are believable, as is the entire story line. Mr. Hopf takes you on a journey through the eyes of a survivor. While the book has an ending that doesn't leave the reader up in the air, it also opens the door to the beginning of another adventure. I am looking forward to the next book in the series. Good job, Mr. Hopf! Keep writing.

The story was just okay for me. It was not a particularly imaginative take on the apocalypse theme, and was very heavy on military themes and characters. (There would be more challenges to be overcome had most of the main characters not had military training. The story would have been far more interesting if they were just normal people with no particular combat readiness.) There really wasn't any resolution at the end, either... Just a hook for the next book.
I really enjoyed this book, I read it non-stop. If you like a well written nonstop action thriller that keeps you on the edge of your seat you will love this one.

This is a good book & the type of book I love to read.  Survival stories are my favorites.  However, as good as this book is, there needs to be some real improvements.  The character development is very poor.  That is the first thing I look for in a book.  The only development in this book is the lack of food & the cruelty of some people.  Not all of the cruelty was caused by the bad guys.  Anyway, Gordon is an egotistical jerk.  Sebastian is a whining child. Connor is a psychopath.  The children, at least Haley, is a spoiled brat.  The women seem to be on another planet. Most of the main characters are not at all likeable.  All of this sounds like this is a terrible book but the writer is good & would be very good if he just added some real characters to read about.  His descriptions are good & not rambling on & on.  I will definitely read the whole series & probably enjoy most of it.  I guess I can't expect Stephen King or F. Paul Wilson in every book but sure would like to have their type of characters to read about.  Even F. Paul Wilson made his main character with a larger than necessary ego but we who read his books also knew the character well enough to see his good points.  So far I haven't found much of a good side to Gordon. He is great at killing anybody & everybody but not sympathizing with the "human condition."  Maybe a lot of us would react the same way in times like these but I want a little better from the books I read.

Just got "The End" and have enjoyed it from the moment I started reading it.  I hate to put it down.  I love when a book takes off like this one.  I can't wait to finish and look forward to part 2.  Great work!
I liked this book because it was not the same old story I'm used to reading. This had a unique group of people with particular skill sets that made survival possible. I look forward to the next book.

The central character is an ultra-narcissist whose only interest is his nuclear family.  His women characters are either good girls (soft, but firm, wives and mothers), or B*****ches who oppose him.  Literally.  He has no recognition of his own amorality or pathology.  But worse, he's boring and predictable.  And that's why I found it impossible to finish.  I just didn't care about any of the characters.
The characters and writing were awful. You could skim over whole pages, knowing you we're missing nothing. Glad it was so inexpensive.

To begin with, I had intended to purchase the Kindle version of this book.  Somehow, my fat fingers must have punched the wrong button and viola...I bought a large (thick) paperback.  First thing I noticed is that Mr. Hopf must have "self published" this book, as I could not find any reference to an external publisher...opening the cover, I was happy to see the fly lacked the usual PC drivel about "Coincidences to any person, living or dead," yada, yada.  Don't know why that pleased me but it did.  Now on to the review; Some readers have started their reviews by saying, "For his first book it was outstanding," etc.  I'm here to tell you that for anyone's book, no matter how far along their literary path they may be, this was an excellent bit of work.  I started the book after dinner and finally put it down with 30 pages left at 1 AM.  Very fast paced with characters that were well-developed and believable.  Bravo, Mr. Hopf.  Can't wait for the followup effort.  Thanks for the lost sleep.  Mk

This is a truly mesmerizing tale, not to mention thought provoking. The EMP he describes has been in the news for quite some time and most people I talk with have no clue as to what it is, let alone it is one of todays most realistic dangers to America. Several countries are working on EMP weapons, I assure you they are not making them for the hell of it. In Mr Hopf's book he realistically details not only the cause but in my opinion very accurate scenarios  in the aftermath of such an event. I simply can not stop reading his novels, one and two have been devoured in the blink of an eye. I'm trying to slowly savor book three while awaiting book four. I know the series has to eventually come to an end, my only hope that his next writing agenda is as compelling as these. I have little doubt I will adore anything this man writes. His description of the chaos after the attack is so real I can feel ad taste it at times. Great writer, please keep it up Mr Hopf.

I must say, I am waiting for the next book in the series...This is definitely one of those "thrower" books...Typically, I can peg what happens next...  not in this book.  Whats good?  The "hero" doesn't make it to his bug out location and has to make due with what he has and where he is...Not everything is cut and dry and the characters have to improvise... It opens up those "cans of worms" that leave you with ~ OH, Never thought of that!  I've often thought that these kinds of novels were just as important as the "how to" books because they give you scenarios and make you think about what YOU would do in certain situations ~ And this book goes to prove that building community is the long neglected prep.  Most excellent job G. Michael ~ looking forward to another sleepless night because of you!  Check out our interview of G Michael at [...]  click on July 16th and enjoy!
Unlike other other books you don't wait for for the action to start.  The End brings you right into the struggle.  A must read!
I love this genre of book.  I love the survival stories.  I have passed this on to friends hopefully everyone will enjoy it.

Very few books have the ability to make me want to buy them after using Amazon's "Look Inside" feature....This was one of those books! Starting the story in the near future and having a reporter interview the main character's daughter not only helps draw you in to the story, it lets the reader know that this is not it for this series. The book shows the harsh realities in which society would crumble if the technology we rely on suddenly dissapeared. At times we as the readers hate the protagonists actions but have to ask ourselves "Would I do any different in this situation"? For this reason it is a great novel it is not only entertaining but also thought provoking. It is a quick read if you have time to read the whole book on my day off!

As many times as I have wondered about the possibility of this future, I have never prepared for it.  I have been completely enthralled, entertained and most importantly informed by "The End".  While I don't read many books these days, I could not wait to get some daily time with this book.  My social life was scheduled around read time!  That hasn't happened in years. I now feel like I am somewhat prepared to deal with life after an EMP attack, should it occur, but I also have more reading to look forward to.  This book is a Survival Guide as well as entertainment and I am very fortunate to call McCall, Idaho my home!  Cheers G. Michael Hopf!

I came across this book while browsing through Amazon's kindle owners' library, and was immediately intrigued by the premise of the novel: what could happen in the event of a large-scale disaster, such as an electromagnetic pulse (EMP) attack.  This book was hard to put down!  I found the story smart, thought-provoking, well written, and engaging.  I appreciate how the book chapters are laid out as a timeline.  This book is a must-read for citizens of modern societies, and serves as an excellent reminder of how much we take electricity (and civility) for granted.  Looking forward to the next installment!

I really felt the Author did a great job writing a believable story with twists and turns that have the reader having a hard time putting the book down.  His character development was good.  It was interesting to see how each character in the book reacts to life and death decisions which made me reflect on how our country would be if this situation played out.  It was interesting to me to see a group of Marines and Sailors defy the orders of a President of a rotting country.  The time to obey orders from phony politicians and Hollywood is over. Cheers....and cant wait to here the rest of the story!

If you liked the movie Red Dawn (the original), you will like this. Though its not Russians invading the US, its does have a similar quality, of a small group of people dealing with the aftermath. I agree that the characters could have been defined more, but I don't think this affected the overall plot. There is enough happening that instead of back-story, we can determine the motives of the individuals by their actions. I am looking forward to the next book "The Long Road" with anticipation. And this promises to be a great series. I also look forward to seeing how Hopf's writing progresses.

This book set me off. I was infatuated with it from the get go. Gordon as a lead character is intelligent and swift. His perception of the sudden reality cast upon him was engrossing. I really enjoyed the multiple perspectives in the book as well. From Connor to Sebastian and back to Gordon and his family, it was nice to see the multiplle views of the catastrophic event. Loved the book and im already on the 3rd in the series. Ill be patiently awaiting book 4. Thanks G. Michael Hopf , youve opened my eyes to how quickly life could change as we know it.

I enjoyed this book. It didn't seem like 400+ pages because I managed to read it in roughly 24 hours. Sleep and normal life duties interfered with me finishing it faster. It reminded me of a cross between the James Rawles series and One Second After by William Forstchen. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was due to a couple very tiny errors that were nearly unnoticeable. I am eagerly awaiting the next book in this series and have already recommended this work to some friends and family. Overall I say worthwhile!

This book was exciting to read from beginning to end. It's the kind of book that makes you think, and makes you wonder. It also inspired me to Thank God that things are not that bad in the US...yet, and I hope they never are. For me, I encourage the other readers to see the book for what it is....a fiction novel based upon a premise...what would happen if? I read the 2nd book in the series, The Long Road, and am anxiously awaiting book 3. You won't be wasting your time reading this book, if you like a lot of action, and enjoy imagining how things could be.

Purchased from Amazon...I've read dozens of Post-Apocalyptic novels & most (but certainly not all) were entertaining but I definitely rank 'THE END' as one of the best written & most enjoyable of all! The arthur, Mr. Hopf certainly did his homework & it is easy for the reader to imagine that his story accurately depicts how people might react & survive at the end-of-the-world as we know it. Once started, it was simply difficult to put down! You won't go wrong buying this book.

I just finished reading this book and all I can say is WOW!! The character development was great, and from the moment you started reading it just engrossed you in the novel. Before I read this novel my favorite book in this genre was "One Second After" which was a great book as well but this far tops that novel. I highly recommend this book to anyone that liked "One Second After" or "77 Days in September". I cannot wait for the next book in this series.

For a new author, Mr. Hopf has done a very good job on this first book  in the series.  While there were a few typos, he (or someone else) clearly did a great job editing.  This is no mean feat for a new author!  The book is well thought out, decently researched and entirely plausible.  The world created is well crafted indeed without falling to the tropes fo all too many apocalyptic novels.  This is an excellent read for anyone who's a fan of such material and I look forward to the next book!

I have not finished this book because i dont want it to end. The story is totally believable, not like some or most post disaster books ive read. You see life through the eyes and thoughts of the characters and are gradually led into a world of chaos. First of all...there are a lot of us who review books and don't even know how to "get paid" for 5 star reviews!  Second---yes, there are errors in syntax, grammar, and POV, but give the guy a break---it's his first book!  As for character development---I felt I understood  the characters right away---I don't have to have pages of "filler" and background to recognize dialogue and actions as believable and understandable.  Is there anyone who's ever dealt with a power hungry president of some winky organization (in this case the HOA of the protagonist's neighborhood)?  If so, you recognize the type immediately! :).  As for the ex-Marine being super tough and not seeming to care about anyone other than his family and close friends---the few sentences about Iraq in 1994 should explain that!  And the ship's commander who led a mutiny?  Come on--do you expect our guys to sail halfway around the world to  sift through ashes in NYC and DC--when their families are clustered around the base in southern California?  Yes, there were horrific scenes of murder and mayhem---but a relatively small and short-lived disaster like Katrina spawned horrific scenes too. (You watch--I'll get mail over that last sentence!! :).. Not all survivors of disasters are saintly...and saving one's children would become a priority over behaving nicely!  So...all those nay-sayers should just write their own if they are such experts!  I've pre-ordered the sequel...I found The End entertaining, and if you like PA fiction, get it, read it and enjoy!

I haven't read such a good book in a while!  The author did a good job developing the characters and the story line. We all wonder what would happen if our world as we know it went through a disaster. God forbid that this were to come true!!

After searching several titles I decided on The End and wasn't disappointed! Well written story about characters with real life emotions, abilities, strengths, and weaknesses. I'm  anxiously waiting for the follow up!

I liked this book and the perspective it had on telling this story from the future, so that you know despite the destruction and ruin the EMP event caused some people get through it.  I also think the author did a nice job of analyzing the general public response, or lack of to the initial event.  Some authors have the general public going to guns  and violence pretty quick.  I would like to think that the response and time line would be closer to how this book presented it.  I'm waiting for the sequel to come out this summer.

If you like this kind of science fiction/fantasy it is in the group of some of the best books I have ever read. Keeps you hanging on every page and always wanting to continue where I left off. Looking forward to reading a sequel to this book.
A must read. Couldn't put it down. Do yourself a favor and get this book. You'll be glad you did.
Really liked the timeline style of the story.  Characters were fleshed out and believable.  Will be looking for more from this author.
I'll have to read the next book when it comes out, that is if I haven't lost I interest by then.
In the realm of end of the world EMP stories, this one stands out.  It's well written and keeps you engaged through the entire book.  If you like EMP stories, this one will certainly satisfy.
I was suprised at how much i liked the book. It kept me so captivated that i had to take a day off just to finish it. I cant wait for book 2 to come out.

Some of my favorite indie books are those that bring the author's area of expertise into increasing the realism of the story. Michael G. Hopf does this here better than almost any other indie sci-fi book I've read. His characterization of the collapse of society following an EMP attack is both chilling and fascinating. Of all the indie sci fi I've read over the past few months, I still remember this book for that reason. I am very much looking forward to the sequel!

I have been reading many Kindle books of this genre. This one grabbed my attention in the first couple of pages. I jokingly call these books my "prepper porn". This is a keeper. I am looking forward to reading the next book. Please hurry and publish!

I can say that I enjoyed every other chapter. I'm even considering purchasing the second book in the future (oh yea, they forgot to tell you the story doesn't end here). It was a lot of the "In Iraq" military hoopla that I just brushed over. I don't know anything about the military, or they're slang. It was written well enough that I could follow the story regardless; and that part of the story was necessary to get the full aspect of what the author was going for but it wasn't as enjoyable to me. Really did enjoy the "end though". Hope this author writes more to come.
Great work in the post apocalyptic genre.  Hooked you from the beginning and kept you up reading it till the end.
I love his style of writing. Great plot, great characters, how he breakdown it down. I can hardly wait for the next book. I have to find out what happens to everyone. Again a very good book..........
Tons of action. A real page turner. I read the whole book in two days, couldn't put it down! It was so exciting! Can't wait for the second book!!!

Extremely entertaining and thought provoking, The End is apocalyptic fiction at it's best.  G. Michael Hopf has written a real page turner with characters you come to care about.  I can't wait to read the next book!
Great book! Don't make the mistake of starting it right before bed. I couldn't put it down! Please release the second one soon!!!

The premise of the book is a what could happen in the future if all things electrical didn't work any longer. The story is seen through thee eyes of a number of characters as civilization crumbles. I did not find that the book's characters and plot were as we'll developed as I've read in other novels, but an interesting read nevertheless. I'm waiting for book two.
I thoroughly enjoyed this book. It was very well written. I am looking forward to the second installment when it comes out.
This was an excellent read. Made me think about being prepared for a crisis. I will definitely get the next book in the series when it comes out.

I rated this highly, as I've read many books of the same genre, and found this one involving almost all aspects of a future without our daily luxuries.  It also addressed a bit of military involvement should a world crisis occur.  I'd recommend the book to anyone interested in the "what if" scenario of post-apocalyptic survival.  Looking forward to the sequel this summer!
Very very good read not a lot of information as some others I have but nevertheless a very good well written book.
I loved this book but now I am engrossed in another story ever I have to wait who knows how long to read the next one . Cannot wait to see where this story takes us .

A beautiful day in San Diego turns into nightmare when unknown forces strike the USA with EMP and city busting Nukes.  See how one man copes with the new normal in which one must kill or be killed as society quickly devolves like a blown tire.  Surprises loom on most every page for Our hero,  the US Marines in Afghanistan, and the country's Speaker of the House cum President...in this well written and edited book.  I can't wait for part two to be published in summer 2013!

This book was GREAT!!! I have read a lot of fiction that has tried to make you feel what the future would be like if you had something really bad happen in our country but this one hit it on the head. Most people would not even think about a power age being a attack but it could happen so easy just like this book. Can't wait for the next one to come out. I also posted on the Facebook page and was glad to get a reply.
I enjoyed this book from the beginning right up to the Cliff-hanger ending. I thought it was well laid out and the characters were believable. I look forward to the next book!

While the writing is a bit stiff at first, the story is gripping and not a little scary in the possibility that the scenario has the real ability to occur. The characters with the exception of the main character's wife are very believable. The author does an incrediblly realistic job showing the rapid breakdown of society. (Adding a few pages to depict conversations between the main character and his wife would make their relationship seem less one-sided and give the wife more depth) Regardless of the minor flaws, I am very eagerly awaiting the next book in this trilogy and I highly recommend this book to anyone who enjoys being unable to put a book down until they reach the end.
I am dying for the next one to be out. I hated when this one ended. A really good read that shows an excellent insight to human behavior. WTG..G. Michael Hopf!
Several different story lines all coming together at the right time to make the book interesting and looking forward to the next.
Great read didnt bog down anywere. Looking forward to the next book. Would recommend this for folks that enjoy this genre. Review by William Womack.
I do like an end of the world saga. It's even better to read one without zombies. The scenario sounds feasible and therefore believable. I found it hard to put down and cannot wait for the sequel.

I loved this book!  It is a true glimpse into what would take place if this event happened today.  Truly this is a must read wakeup call that as a nation of people we are losing the ability of critical thinking that gives us the ability to survive as a nation of people!

This book was extremely well written. The main characters were not just some faceless people from doomsday preppers but actual people. The characters had depth that leaped off the page. The story moved at a fast pace that never slowed down. It was amazing and yet realistic to see how quickly civilization broke down. A lot of the books in this genre either get bogged down in the minutiae of preparation or skills or have shallow main characters. This had neither. Granted most of their food and stuff came from scrounging aka looting but I thought given the story how most people would react this was the most realistic outcome. I also realize I hate typing reviews on a kindle keyboard. I can't wait for the next book in the series.
have not had a read this good in a long time.  action max.  bad thing is hopf left every thing hanging for the next book.  like the gunslinger 1st of king's dark tower series.  we want more!

Thoroughly enjoyed this book, finishing it in two nights (missed some sleep, but worth it).  I enjoy most zombie apocalypse novels and this was a nice change for me.  It still has all the "fun" things....... survival, good vs evil, relationships and some awesome battle scenes (yes, women can enjoy that ,too!).  Loved the character development, but hope for a little more depth in the next book.

I liked the author's ability to tell a story and move it along. The characters and scenarios were believable. Please eliminate a few grammatical errors, especially the sentence fragments, and this reads very well.  I will buy the next book in the series.

In the genre of "grid-down" shtf survivalist stories, G. Micheal Hopf's 'The End' is the first book that comes anywhere close the level of "Light's Out" by David Crawford.  What makes this story easy to connect with is that the main characters are portrayed as realistic people and the disfunctional neighbors are who you would find in any middle-America community. Even though it's a great story to get people thinking about personal preparedness, the better lesson was gained in leadership do's and don'ts! Alot can also be learned in what kind of neighbor you want to be and in the lessons of Gunny, when to keep your mouth shut and when to go stealth. It is truelly a shame that this book has been crafted in chopped-up portions of a series instead of a full sit down novel or one that's complete to put on the library shelf. Some edit/typos but common in this genre...hate waiting for part 2...but will.
Well written, good story line, and well devoleped characters.  One of the better books in the genre I have read.  I hope he follows up on this book.  Well worth the money.

I enjoyed the read, however I was concerned by the shoot first, ask questions later approach, employed by so many of the main characters.  I have no right to criticize the writer, and won't, but remember as you read this book, it describes one possible viewpoint.  As a Marine, I am skeptical of stories involving rogue Marines.  But none of us can forecast the world waiting for in the future.  As one old Marine General once said, "Be polite.  Be professional. And have a plan to kill everyone you meet". God bless America!
Very well written and thoroughly enjoying. Can not wait for the next one. This has gone to the top of my list for this genre.
I liked the authors writing style, he keep you on edge and you couldn't put the book down. I look forward to his future works

It's a bullseye in the post apocalyptic wave of books and TV shows out there.  Full of action and he takes the time to develop deep characters that are believable and interesting. I liked that the book shows different storylines going on simultaneously in different parts of the world.  I can easily see this book becoming a future TV or movie.  Most of all - I love that it is a post apocalyptic story with NO zombies!! (not one).
Great read, one of the best post apoc. Books ever I would recommend this to any post apoc. Lover! Awesome

This was an excellent read. I liked the fact that the book started with the ending and then cycled back to the beginning. The three stories made the situation more real and frightening. The back and forth between these stories kept me engaged. I look forward to the sequel.

It started a bit slow but became a real page turner once it got going. I would have liked a little more "outside the gate" story telling but there was plenty of action and the multi-able story lines were very easy to follow. No super hero charterers but plenty of raw shoot-em up action. Worth the kindle price.

I downloaded this and lost all concept of time. Very real,scary story. I read lots of these and this one is among the top. Some say this author went to far,I say it was RIGHT ON!!  How far would you go to protect your family?  Some reviewers complained about the grammar. I say to them to read a dictionary. Lets keep it simple....YOUR GONNA LOVE IT

As a fan of the post-apocolyptic genre, I really enjoyed this book. Mr. Hopf really keeps the action moving along. There were a few instances where I thought characters acted inexplicably violently, but overall I felt the book really gave a realistic portrayal of society's probable downfall after an EMP. Looking forward to the sequel.

This story can happen all too easily and most people are blissfully unaware until it is too late. Is it the greatest work of fiction ever?  No, but it is a well written, good and timely story about how life can change in an instant.  The characters are people you can easily relate to, the protagonists are people that are like most everyday people you know with their good and bad sides.  The antagonists are people that you easily recognize in your neighborhoods as well.  It may be all too accurate.  If you are a liberal you will likely hate this book as it doesn't relate to Utopian ideals but the reality of how the world really works everyday even though the hints of politics are very subtle in the story.  Liberals probably will not recognize themselves in the story until too late but everyone else will spot them immediately.  I blew through this book.  Great reading and I pray that it forever remains a work of fiction.
The best post-apocalyptic novel I've ever read. Great plot, characters, and a realistic scenario. Looking forward to the next installment.
Well written with engaing characters. One of the best in the genre that I have read in awhile. I am eager to read the sequel.

This is a well written, thought provoking book that also entertains and maybe scares, just a little.  I wouldn't want to live in Gordon's post-war San Diego or in any part of the post-war country for that matter, but it's quite believable and the characters are well developed.  Can't wait to read Part 2!  Keep writing Mr. Hopf!

pretty good story, but neither prose nor editing are very good. decent characters, and story and details are believeable. i got very tired of some conversations and repeated lines. the final third of the book appears to be unedited with tons of grammatical errors, typos and even a switch to present tense on a few pages. all in all, an enjoyable read, but a bit flawed.

Though I've never read a book in the post-apocalyptic genre, I found this book very easy to read and interesting from start to finish. Well developed characters and the story line was believable to the point it had me asking myself, "would my family & friends be prepared?" I look forward to the next one!!

I got this for free awhile back, but ust read it.  Pretty darn good book.  You can read the entire book in less than 4 hours.  Gets you pretty engrossed, so much I purchased the second book in the series (of 4 books) about 2 minutes after I completed this one.  Thanks for the fun read Mr. Hopf!

This was one of the best apocalyptic books I've read.  Well written and only a couple times that I rolled my eyes, which is excellent with these type books.  You never knew what was going to happen next.  I'd say more but I have to go order The Long Road now and continue our journey.  Buy it!

Great story. A fast paced and exciting story line. One problem is that with a lot of these stories you have to wait for the next book to complete the story and sometimes that can be frustrating if you do a lot of reading and trying to keep all of the various story lines correct.

This book took off from the beginning and kept my attention through out.  It was fast paced and never dull.  What was even better, was the realistic portrayal of the characters and how they reacted to everything that was going on around them.  Can't wait for the sequel!

Some of the best character development I've seen In a long while. Really enjoying seeing how the event  effects the various characters  in different settings. I cant wait for the next in the series.  Mr. Hopf thank you for your service and keep the stories coming!

The New World Series, by G. Michael Kopf, Splendid. Enjoy this genre when well done, and this was. Description of the rapid decay of society was spot on. As well as detailing all the various agendas. Think Barone was my CO at one time.Good job Marine...

Love this genre. The End by G. Michael Hopf continues to feed my inner craving for world devastation. Great character development for both good and evil characters. Very well written page turner. This writer has me hooked. Looking forward to more.

Didn't want to put it down and sorry I couldn't run right out and buy the next in the series.  Thought provoking.  The characters were well defined and real.  Anxiously awaiting the new one.  Thanks for the entertainment.

Great storyline - very good character development! I hope this is the first of many more books to come.  Gordon is my hero. A "must read" and as with all of these books, you will learn a lot.  You will enjoy this book.
G Michael Hopf writes some very good books.  I really enjoyed this book.  This could actually happen and we all need to be prepared with food storage and water storage...we all need to be prepared.
Once I started I could not put this book down.  Fast paced and great story line.  Can't wait for the next in the series, The Long Road. Highly recommend for those liking SHTF scenario.
This book is a good read. I am a fan of the post-apocalyptic genre and this series so far hasn't disappointed. I'm currently working reading the second one and have the third waiting.
This book is an awesome page turner!  I felt like I was there along side the characters throughout the story!  I'm so ready for the next book!  G Michael Hopf is a great writer!
I loved the book. the style just fit with the story line. It's just too good for words and I hope that all the people that read this review enjoy this book as much as I did.
Nice story and easy to get into and dream of what it might just be like soon. I hope nothing goes down but I honestly don't see how we can keep going without a major Reset.
a little amatuerish writeing at times but still a good read.... i may be predudiced since im an ex army guy tho... i liked it tho... its a nice change from zombies
never heard of this author, i took a chance. good storyline and reasonably realistic scenarios. ill be looking for the next book in the series.
Great book, couldn't put it down. So ready for the next book, which I've pre-ordered! I will recommend this book to my friends and family!
Gripping, too possible.  Totally enthralling, lots of action, and many twists and turns.  Have just gotten to the ending pages.
Another nice post apocalyptic novel with a different reason being the EMP burst.  And the other twist about what the Marines do/respond.
From the beginning it jumped off at a very fast pace.  I am looking forward to more of the story line if he puts out another book.
I liked the book. I think there should have been more about the rest of the country. Little vignettes ala stephen King.
This was a great read with Good flow and memorable characters. Very hard to put down. Now moving on to the next book.
Our very possible future, if people don't wake up.  This book tells it like it very well may be, soon then we think.

The content is really good for this genre (end of the world as we know it). It is written in a style that keeps the action moving at a fast pace but with time enough to draw out some of the main characters. More character development of the secondary folks in the book would be nice. And the main character actualy gets shot - will wonders never cease. Could an EMP cause all of this damage? It really is an unknown but setting that aside what we see in this book feels true - at least believable. With that said I do have to point out the printing and proofreading are very poor. That is why I gave it one less star (the only reason). The proofing errors do detract from the reading experience. I hope they correct this in the sequel - and I will be reading the sequel as soon as it comes out.
Easy read, page turner of a book. Enjoyed start to finish. Excited to sink my teeth into "The Long Road".
Started the read and did not want to put it down. I was able to put myself right there within the story.
I read this book in 2 days.The story in this book seems so real that it just grabs you and won't let go.

The author has a great ability to make you dislike the leading characters in the book.  The whole premise that military commanders would not follow orders and would become traitors to our country in order to return to their families is insulting to anyone who has ever worn a uniform.  I will avoid books by this author from now on.
Loved it. Already started on book 2. Really enjoyed the character development and storyline.

I enjoyed Michael Hoff's writing style. It is a clear cut above the average in this genre. An exciting plot with well-drawn characters makes this a very good read.  That said, I almost gave it four stars instead of five because I didn't care for the ending. Not that it was a bad ending, but it, like other serial novels, left me feeling like I'd just read an incomplete book. Now, his book and his ending were much better than most other serials I've read, and I had fair warning that this was a serial novel, so I couldn't hold the abrupt nature of the ending against him. Besides, his style was entertaining so I'll continue to read his books.

Geoff did and excellent job of creating the characters that you can believe in and actually care about whats happening to them, keeping the reader interested in what is going to happen next them. I personally could not put the book down and truly looking forward to the next installment. Thanks Geoff truly enjoyed your book. :)

It should be no secret that a lot of people were struck with patriotism after 9/11. That wa the worst attack in my lifetime, but what happens in this book is both terrifying and exciting. I could only imagine how I would act if an EMP strike sent us back to the 19th century and we had to fight to survive. In fact I think I picked up a few ideas from this awesome book. Looks like I'm going for the next one in this series to see just where it goes. I suggest you do this same!
Excellent story line. I cannot wait to read the next book.
Excellent storyline.  Easy to read.

Thoroughly enjoyed this one. The story contains some great action and the writer had me pulling for Gordon from the start. Kind of struck a nerve when I read about the self serving HOA president. As soon as I finished this book I grabbed the second in the series. I highly recommend!
I was surprised and thrilled by just how good this book is! I got quickly caught up in the characters and the story. I'm going to buy the second one right now!
I thought this was a great story, characters feel real. Hard to put down at night. Interesting storyline and character development.
Well written.  It kept me on the edge of my seat.  A real finger swiper (page turner for you non-electronic types).

The End is an interesting spin on the post apocalyptic genre, that in some ways makes it seem a little more real. Set half a century after the event and told from the perspective of the daughter of the main character. At the time of the relating of this story (as an interview), Gordon is seen as a historical figure who influenced the birth of a new and very different North American nation that rose from the ashes. Highly recommended for those with an interest in the end of the world & who wonder what comes after...

I buy these books for my husband's Kindle and he let's me know ahead of time that he is getting close to the end and I was surprised that he had read this book ahead of time, he said he just couldn't put it down. He said excellent book, it could very well be something that could happen in this present time. We understand he has another book that may be out sometime this summer, he is looking forward to the next book.

My husband and I enjoy a good post apocalyptic story and this one is one of the good ones. I wish I had known at the beginning that the story was to be continued in another book. That was the only real problem I had with it. It could have used another proof reading as there were some spelling errors but even so it is better than a majority of this type book available. All in all a good read.

I have been devouring post apocalypse survival books for about a year. First this book has been the best edited. Second very well developed characters. Plot actually holds water. One story line in this book is similar to another book which is  coincidence and a very important part of developing the plot. 4 and half stars and easily falls in my top 3

I loved the book. Love his style of writing. Be prepared for a roller coaster of a ride through this book. The 3 subplots are great. You love the characters. His development of post apocalyptic politics is very plausible. One of the better books in the genre I have read. This review is for all 3 in the series.

I basically just don't like the protagonists. Gordon is rollback and white, and does some pretty terrible things that aren't really necessary. The "super emp" thing is a bit unrealistic as well, but it is a decent device. I'm not 100% about this, but it seems far fetched to launch a rocket 300 miles up from a container ship. That is 3 times higher than the International Space station.

Story gets 5 stars. Writing only 4. Every third page or so there was a grammatical error. That makes for a lot of errors. It did slow down the book somewhat. A comma missing here or there? No problem. Missing words and misplaced words? Big problem. Good story though.
Despite many flaws I do see potential.  The basic plot is enough to grab your attention. I only hope that in time this new writer will learn more about character and scenery development

While I enjoyed the premise of the book and where the author had us headed, I was less then enthusiastic about the 'to be continued' aspect of it.  There had been no wording in the description that said this book was the first of a series. Not that I don't like series, I just would have been happy to know beforehand and I might have waited until the next book was written before starting it. The story itself was quite engaging and really makes you think, what would happen if everything stopped working?
Post apocalyptic journey from a family and community perspective.  Great characters and storyline.  Well worth the money.  Book 1 in a series.

Seems that every person in the book was dealing with the most difficult moral dilemma. Without giving too much away, I struggled with many of the choices they did finally make. I'm going to read the sequel, ??? The writer must have hooked me in.
Not so bad that I might not try the sequel, but I will have to have a dirth on my regular authors to reach out again to this, new to me author.
This is a fantastic book. When I finished it I could not wait to start the second book. Not a book for kids.
Good character development and unexpected twists leave the reader waiting for he next twist.  it can't end here.  a virus, an invention, some human qwirk... what will save the planet?
enjoyed the book.  2nd book is out and hope to read it soon.  looking forward to seeing where this series goes.

Well written, kept my interest the entire time. Very believable story this could happen. Shows that not only are people at their best in a crisis but also their very worst. Glad to see there is a sequel to this that just came out in August.

With the current administration acting as it is, it is possible that this kind of scenario could take place.Having moved out of San Clemente several years ago,it was close to the area the story took place in.I could visualize the neighborhood Gordon lived in,all the petty egotistic "Rulers"of the complex h lived in hit close to what probably could happen
Written from the perspective of military & government personnel, this book has a very realistic feel to it. Sad to see how fast society crumbles, but I'm sure that is exactly what would happen.
Over dramatic writing. I never felt connected to the characters. I don't think I would read the others in the series. I don't like the writing style.

Starts slow but after about 100 pages you start to get interested .IT sounded like a romance novel in the beginning . I guess the apocalyptic novel is the rage now that teenage angst is out of fashion.
Very believable scenario, thoroughly enjoyed it.I can't wait till his next book. I wonder when it's going to be released?
Good book enjoyed it cannot wait for the next one. Awesome story kept me wanting more really kept me interested.

A good read, if you're into all things post-apocalyptic; as I reckon I am, based on most of my recent purchases.  I'm looking forward to the next in the series.  You won’t be disappointed in it as it develops the characters well, it’s not just about the landscape.
The EMP bursts over many countries was a new twist. Some parts were predictable, but overall it was an enjoyable story.
This was a good read. Was pretty quick read, lots of action, but I wanted more. I will wait until the next book comes out.
While it is not the most well written book I have ever read, it kept me wanting to know what happened next, and the characters were easy to fall in love with.
The book had a good story line. The main characters had detail but the dialog was very stilted, especially the last part of th book.
Interesting but overly pessimistic view of what might happen after an EMP attack on the US. Quick read bit unsatisfying ending.
A very quick and easy read. The characters are interesting, and the author is writing from a position of knowledge (see his website).
Enjoyed the story and would have liked more detail about EMP.  Hope there is a follow up about their life in Idaho.
I can't say I love any of the characters, but I want to know what happens to them. I'm ready for the second book.
I really enjoyed the book. The characters were believable. The pacing was good. I look forward to the next one.

I just wanted to say how much I loved this book. I am from san diego, so when the author used the city as a back drop. I was great to read about places I know. the fact that the main issue was emp(which is a possibility),shows how the author put this setting in a probable scenario. was very well written. I am a fan of the post-apocalyptic gengre and cant wait til next month when the second book comes oout. keep up the good work. the brothers van Zandt rule.

This was an interesting novel. The characters were well developed and generally believable. I will read the next installment. There were a few anachronisms and some of the philosophy was a little skewed. The story is not too predictable and often turned out differently than expected.
This was a pretty good read. It takes you thru the fall of America from different vantage points. There are better books with greater detail but its worth the time.
This was a awesome book cannot wait for part 2. Now I can get some other stuff done couldn't put it down.
I have read quite a few attempts at post-apocalyptic fiction & I enjoyed this one very much.  Well written with an insightful look at human nature.  Looking forward to reading the sequel.
I really enjoyed this book and cannot wait for the sequel, this book grabs you at the start and is non stop action all the way
Really enjoyed this novel and even though there are slot of characters I want to know what's going to happen to them all. I look forward to the sequel!

A lot of the information was too repetitive especially in reference to the emp. Once this was covered, the book took off and began to pull you in. It will be interesting to see how the second book progresses.

I was pretty pleasantly surprised with this book.  It contained two of my favorite subjects to read about: Marines and post-apocalyptic fiction.  I think the author did a pretty decent job at setting up his story with the attack and the results of that attack.  He described what people are capable of in the face of a country becoming dismantled.  The only problem that I had with the book was in one of the last chapters when the author goes from telling the story as a past tense to a present tense in the middle of a chapter.  I applaud the effort and saw from another review that the author is Maryland born and bred.  From another Maryland born and bred Marine, good work and Semper Fi!  I look forward to the next book.

Fast paced.  I liked that the characters have flaws and make mistakes.  The sappy "l love you.  I love you more"parts were a bit too dragged out and took something away from an otherwise well written book.

Not a bad plot line until Marines start murdering innocents.  Stopped reading when protagonist murders an unarmed man trying to save his family.  At that point, the protagonist becomes a heinous criminal and the rules of conduct are gone.  Not what I have time to read about.

This is just the start of many books.  It has some potential with all the story lines left hanging from this book.  It is disappointing to know I must read several more to get this line-up finished.  Gordon shows us he's a real Marine:  he can curse and kill equally well.  That seems to be all it takes for this genre to be successful.

Bought the first three books thinking "trilogy" but it is not. Everyone is ruthless and selfish, even the "hero." What a horrible depiction of humanity. The story lacks any kind of moral center. Kill or be killed, that's the message. Maybe I've been spoiled by "The Walking Dead," where characters struggle to find their moral compass after the veneer of civilization is ripped away, but there's nothing like that here. The only moral dilemma is whether to maintain blind obedience to a mutinous Marine commander, and we don't even find out how that resolves.
